section.title: Java Web Standards
section.para: Standard Java technologies are defined via a standard process called the Java Community Process (JCP) . The following technologies are defined via the JCP.

section.title: Servlet
section.para: A servlet is a Java class which extends "HttpServlet" and answers a HTTP request within a web container. The latest official version is Servlets 3.0 which is also part of Java EE 6. For details see the Java Servlets 3.0 Spec .

section.title: JavaServer Page
section.para:
JavaServer Pages (JSP) are files which contain HTML and Java code. The web cotainer compiles the JSP into a servlet at the first time the JSP is accessed. The current latest version is 2.1.
See Specification for JavaServer Pages 2.1

section.title: JavaServer Pages Standard Tag Library
section.para: The JavaServer Pages Standard Tag Library (JSTL) encapsulates the core functionality common to many Web applications as simple tags. The current version is 1.2 is part of the JavaServer Pages Specification version 2.1.

section.title: Getting started with Java web development
section.para: Getting started with Java Web development is relatively easy. You can try it out via the following Servlet and JSP Tutorial .
